doc.description:
Class text
string manipulation class

This class only uses static methods and has lots of alias for the escaping methods

name: bbn\Str

cast.name: cast
cast.summary: Converts any type of variable to a string.
cast.comments:
/**
   * Converts any type of variable to a string.
   *
   * ```php
   * $st = 122
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::cast($st));
   * // (string) "122"
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::cast(1));
   * // (string) "1"
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::cast(['foo' => 'bar'])
   * // (string) ""
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st The item to cast.
   * @return string
   */

changeCase.name: changeCase
changeCase.summary: Converts the case of a string.

arguments.name: case
arguments.description: The case to convert to ("lower" or "upper"), default being the title case.

params.name: $case
params.description: The case to convert to ("lower" or "upper"), default being the title case.

changeCase.comments:
/**
   * Converts the case of a string.
   *
   * ```php
   * $st = 'TEST CASE';
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::changeCase($st, 'lower'));
   * // (string) "test case"
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::changeCase('TEsT Case', 'upper'));
   * // (string) "TEST CASE"
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::changeCase('test case'));
   * // (string) "Test Case"
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st   The item to convert.
   * @param mixed $case The case to convert to ("lower" or "upper"), default being the title case.
   * @return string
   */

escapeAllQuotes.name: escapeAllQuotes
escapeAllQuotes.summary: Escapes all quotes (single and double) from a given string.

description_parts.content:
X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeDquotes('the "Gay Pride" is is Putin\'s favorite'));
// (string) "the \"Gay Pride\" is is Putin\'s favorite"

escapeAllQuotes.comments:
/**
   * Escapes all quotes (single and double) from a given string.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeDquotes('the "Gay Pride" is is Putin\'s favorite'));
   * // (string) "the \"Gay Pride\" is is Putin\'s favorite"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeDquotes.name: escapeDquotes
escapeDquotes.summary: Escapes the string in double quotes.

description_parts.content:
X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeDquotes('this is the house "Mary"'));
// (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""

escapeDquotes.comments:
/**
   * Escapes the string in double quotes.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeDquotes('this is the house "Mary"'));
   * // (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeDquote.name: escapeDquote

description_parts.content:
X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeDquote('this is the house "Mary"'));
// (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""

escapeDquote.comments:
/**
   * Synonym of "escape_dquotes".
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeDquote('this is the house "Mary"'));
   * // (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeQuote.name: escapeQuote

description_parts.content:
X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeQuote('this is the house "Mary"'));
// (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""

escapeQuote.comments:
/**
   * Synonym of "escape_dquotes".
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeQuote('this is the house "Mary"'));
   * // (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeQuotes.name: escapeQuotes

description_parts.content:
X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeQuotes('this is the house "Mary"'));
// (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""

escapeQuotes.comments:
/**
   * Synonym of "escape_dquotes".
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeQuotes('this is the house "Mary"'));
   * // (string) "this is the house \"Mary\""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeSquotes.name: escapeSquotes
escapeSquotes.comments:
/**
   * Escapes the string in quotes.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeSquotes("Today's \"newspaper\""));
   * // (string)  "Today\'s "newspaper""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

unescapeSquotes.name: unescapeSquotes
unescapeSquotes.comments:
/**
   * Unescapes the string in quotes.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeSquotes("Today's \"newspaper\""));
   * // (string)  "Today\'s "newspaper""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

unescapeSquote.name: unescapeSquote
unescapeSquote.comments:
/**
   * Unescapes the string in quotes.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeSquotes("Today's \"newspaper\""));
   * // (string)  "Today\'s "newspaper""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escape.name: escape
escape.comments:
/**
   * Synonym of "escape_squotes".
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escape("Today's \"newspaper\""));
   * // (string)  "Today\'s "newspaper""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeApo.name: escapeApo
escapeApo.comments:
/**
   * Synonym of "escape_squotes".
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeApo("Today's \"newspaper\""));
   * // (string)  "Today\'s "newspaper""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

escapeSquote.name: escapeSquote
escapeSquote.comments:
/**
   * Synonym of "escape_squotes".
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::escapeSquote("Today's \"newspaper\""));
   * // (string)  "Today\'s "newspaper""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

cleanSpaces.name: cleanSpaces
cleanSpaces.summary: Trims, and removes extra spaces (all more than one)
cleanSpaces.comments:
/**
   * Trims, and removes extra spaces (all more than one)
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(Str::cleanSpaces(" Hello     World\n\n\n  (bool)!    "));
   * // (string)  "Hello World (bool)!"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to escape.
   * @return string
   */

cut.name: cut
cut.summary: Cuts a string (HTML and PHP tags stripped) to maximum length inserted.
cut.comments:
/**
   * Cuts a string (HTML and PHP tags stripped) to maximum length inserted.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::cut("<!-- HTML Document --> Example text", 7));
   * // (string) "Example..."
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st  The string to be cut.
   * @param int    $max The maximum string length.
   * @return string
   */

sanitize.name: sanitize
sanitize.summary: Strip special characters except the below:
sanitize.description:
- ~ , ; [ ] ( ) .
And removes more that two trailing periods

description_parts.content:
- ~ , ; [ ] ( ) .
And removes more that two trailing periods

doc.description:
Strip special characters except the below:
- ~ , ; [ ] ( ) .
And removes more that two trailing periods

sanitize.comments:
/**
   * Strip special characters except the below:
   * - ~ , ; [ ] ( ) .
   * And removes more that two trailing periods
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @return string
   */

encodeFilename.name: encodeFilename
encodeFilename.summary: Returns a cross-platform filename for the file.

arguments.name: maxlength
arguments.description: The maximum filename length (without extension), default: "50".

arguments.name: is_path
arguments.description: path   Tells if the slashes (/) are authorized in the string

params.name: $maxlength
params.description: The maximum filename length (without extension), default: "50".

params.name: $is
params.description: path   Tells if the slashes (/) are authorized in the string

encodeFilename.comments:
/**
   * Returns a cross-platform filename for the file.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::encodeFilename('test file/,1', 15, 'txt'));
   * // (string) "test_file_1.txt"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st        The name as string.
   * @param int    $maxlength The maximum filename length (without extension), default: "50".
   * @param string $extension The extension of the file.
   * @param bool   $is_path   Tells if the slashes (/) are authorized in the string
   * @return string
   */

encodeDbname.name: encodeDbname
encodeDbname.summary: Returns a corrected string for database naming.
encodeDbname.comments:
/**
   * Returns a corrected string for database naming.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::encodeDbname('my.database_name ? test  :,; !plus'));
   * // (string) "my_database_name_test_plus"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st        The name as string.
   * @param int    $maxlength The maximum length, default: "50".
   * @return string
   */

fileExt.name: fileExt

arguments.name: ar
arguments.description: If "true" also returns the file path, default: "false".

params.name: $ar
params.description: If "true" also returns the file path, default: "false".

fileExt.comments:
/**
   * Returns the file extension.
   *
   * ```php
   * // (string) "txt"
   * X::dump(Str::fileExt("/test/test.txt"));
   *
   * // (array) [ "test", "txt", ]
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::fileExt('/home/user/Desktop/test.txt', true));
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $file The file path.
   * @param bool   $ar   If "true" also returns the file path, default: "false".
   * @return string|array
   */

genpwd.name: genpwd
genpwd.comments:
/**
   * Returns a random password.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::genpwd());
   * // (string) "khc9P871w"
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::genpwd(6, 4));
   * // (string) "dDEtxY"
   * ```
   *
   * @param int $int_max Maximum password characters, default: "12".
   * @param int $int_min Minimum password characters, default: "6".
   * @return string
   */

isHTML.name: isHTML

data2Html.name: data2Html

isJson.name: isJson
isJson.summary: Checks if the string is a json string.
isJson.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the string is a json string.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isJson('{"firstName": "John", "lastName": "Smith", "age": 25}'));
   * // (bool) true
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string.
   * @return bool
   */

isNumber.name: isNumber
isNumber.summary: Checks if the item is a number.
isNumber.description: Can take as many arguments and will return false if one of them is not a number.

description_parts.content: Can take as many arguments and will return false if one of them is not a number.

isNumber.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the item is a number.
   * Can take as many arguments and will return false if one of them is not a number.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isNumber([1, 2]));
   * // (bool) false
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isNumber(150);
   * // (bool) 1
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isNumber('150'));
   * // (bool)  1
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isNumber(1.5);
   * // (bool) 1
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st The item to be tested.
   * @return bool
   */

getNameFromIndex.name: getNameFromIndex

isInteger.name: isInteger
isInteger.summary: Checks if the item is a integer.
isInteger.description: Can take as many arguments and will return false if one of them is not an integer or the string of an integer.

description_parts.content: Can take as many arguments and will return false if one of them is not an integer or the string of an integer.

isInteger.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the item is a integer.
   * Can take as many arguments and will return false if one of them is not an integer or the string of an integer.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isInteger(13.2));
   * // (bool) false
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isInteger(14));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isInteger('14'));
   * // (bool) true
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st The item to be tested.
   * @return bool
   */

isCleanPath.name: isCleanPath
isCleanPath.summary: Checks if ".. \\" or "../" is contained in the parameter and it will return false if true.
isCleanPath.comments:
/**
   * Checks if ".. \\" or "../" is contained in the parameter and it will return false if true.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isCleanPath("/home/user/Images"));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isCleanPath("../home/user/Images"));
   * // (bool) false
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isCleanPath("..\\home\user\Images"));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st The item to be tested.
   * @return bool
   */

isDecimal.name: isDecimal
isDecimal.summary: Checks if the item is a decimal.
isDecimal.description: Can take many arguments and it will return false if one of them is not a decimal or the string of a decimal (float).

description_parts.content: Can take many arguments and it will return false if one of them is not a decimal or the string of a decimal (float).

isDecimal.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the item is a decimal.
   * Can take many arguments and it will return false if one of them is not a decimal or the string of a decimal (float).
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDecimal(13.2));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDecimal('13.2'));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDecimal(14));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st The item to be tested.
   * @return bool
   */

isUid.name: isUid
isUid.summary: Checks if the string is a valid UID string.
isUid.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the string is a valid UID string.
   *
   * ```php
   * Str::isUid('22e4f42122e4f42122e4f42122e4f421');
   * // (bool) true
   * $this->assertFalse(Str::isUid('22e4f42122e4f4212'));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @return boolean
   */

isBuid.name: isBuid
isBuid.summary: Checks if the string is a valid binary UID string.

doc.description: Checks if the string is a valid binary UID string.

isBuid.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the string is a valid binary UID string.
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @return boolean
   */

isEmail.name: isEmail
isEmail.summary: Checks if the string is the correct type of e-mail address.
isEmail.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the string is the correct type of e-mail address.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isEmail('test@email.com'));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isEmail('test@email'));
   * // (bool) false
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isEmail('test@.com'));
   * // (bool) false
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isEmail('testemail.com'));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $email E-mail address.
   * @return bool
   */

isUrl.name: isUrl
isUrl.summary: Checks if the argument is a valid URL string.
isUrl.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the argument is a valid URL string.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isUrl("http://bbn.so"));
   * // (string) "https://bbn.so"
   *
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isUrl("bbn.so"));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to perform
   * @return string|false
   */

isDomain.name: isDomain
isDomain.summary: Checks if the argument is a valid domain name.
isDomain.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the argument is a valid domain name.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDomain("http://bbn.so"));
   * // (string) false
   *
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDomain("bbn.so"));
   * // (bool) true
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string to perform
   * @return bool
   */

isIp.name: isIp
isIp.summary: Checks if the argument is a valid ip address.
isIp.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the argument is a valid ip address.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isIp('198.162.0.1'));
   * // (bool) true
   *
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isIp('29e4:4068:a401:f273:dcec:af8f:c8b3:c01c'));
   * // (bool) true
   *
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isIp('198.162'));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param $st
   * @return bool
   */

isDateSql.name: isDateSql
isDateSql.summary: Checks if the argument is in a valid SQL date format.
isDateSql.comments:
/**
   * Checks if the argument is in a valid SQL date format.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDateSql("1999-12-05 11:10:22"));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDateSql("1999-12-05"));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::isDateSql("19-12-1999"));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @return bool
   */

correctTypes.name: correctTypes
correctTypes.summary: If it looks like an int or float type, the string variable is converted into the correct type.
correctTypes.comments:
/**
   * If it looks like an int or float type, the string variable is converted into the correct type.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::correctTypes(1230));
   * // (int) 1230
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::correctTypes(12.30));
   * // (float) 12.3
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::correctTypes("12.3"));
   * // (float) 12.3
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::correctTypes([1230]));
   * // (int) [1230]
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $st
   * @return mixed
   */

parseUrl.name: parseUrl
parseUrl.summary: Returns an array containing any of the various components of the URL that are present.

doc.description:
Returns an array containing any of the various components of the URL that are present.

```php
X::hdump(\bbn\Str::parseUrl('http://localhost/phpmyadmin/?db=test&table=users&server=1&target=&token=e45a102c5672b2b4fe84ae75d9148981');
/* (array)
[
    'scheme' => 'http',
    'host' => 'localhost',
    'path' => '/phpmyadmin/',
    'query' => 'db=test&table=users&server=1&target=&token=e45a102c5672b2b4fe84ae75d9148981',
    'url' => 'http://localhost/phpmyadmin/',
    'params' => [
        'db' => 'test',
        'table' => 'users',
        'server' => '1',
        'target' => '',
        'token' => 'e45a102c5672b2b4fe84ae75d9148981',
    ],
]
```

parseUrl.comments:
/**
   * Returns an array containing any of the various components of the URL that are present.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::hdump(\bbn\Str::parseUrl('http://localhost/phpmyadmin/?db=test&table=users&server=1&target=&token=e45a102c5672b2b4fe84ae75d9148981');
   * /* (array)
   * [
   *     'scheme' => 'http',
   *     'host' => 'localhost',
   *     'path' => '/phpmyadmin/',
   *     'query' => 'db=test&table=users&server=1&target=&token=e45a102c5672b2b4fe84ae75d9148981',
   *     'url' => 'http://localhost/phpmyadmin/',
   *     'params' => [
   *         'db' => 'test',
   *         'table' => 'users',
   *         'server' => '1',
   *         'target' => '',
   *         'token' => 'e45a102c5672b2b4fe84ae75d9148981',
   *     ],
   * ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $url The url.
   * @return array
   */

parsePath.name: parsePath
parsePath.summary: Replaces backslash with slash in a path string. Forbids the use of ../

arguments.name: allow_parent
arguments.description: parent If true ../ is allowed in the path (and will become normalized).

params.name: $allow
params.description: parent If true ../ is allowed in the path (and will become normalized).

parsePath.comments:
/**
   * Replaces backslash with slash in a path string. Forbids the use of ../
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::parsePath('\home\user\Desktop'));
   * // (string) "/home/user/Desktop"
   *
   *  X::dump(\bbn\Str::parsePath('..\home\user\Desktop'));
   * // (string) ""
   *
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::parsePath('..\home\user\Desktop', true));
   * // (string) "home/user/Desktop"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string  $path         The path.
   * @param boolean $allow_parent If true ../ is allowed in the path (and will become normalized).
   * @return string
   */

removeAccents.name: removeAccents
removeAccents.summary: Replaces accented characters with their character without the accent.

description_parts.content:
X::dump(\bbn\Str::removeAccents("TÃ¨st FÃ¬lÃ¨ Ã²Ã¨Ã Ã¹è"));
// (string) TA¨st FA¬lA¨ A²A¨A A¹e"

removeAccents.comments:
/**
   * Replaces accented characters with their character without the accent.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::removeAccents("TÃ¨st FÃ¬lÃ¨ Ã²Ã¨Ã Ã¹è"));
   * // (string) TA¨st FA¬lA¨ A²A¨A A¹e"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string.
   * @return string
   */

checkName.name: checkName
checkName.summary: Checks if a string complies with SQL naming convention.
checkName.comments:
/**
   * Checks if a string complies with SQL naming convention.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::checkName("Paul"));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::checkName("Pa ul"));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @return bool
   */

checkFilename.name: checkFilename
checkFilename.summary: Checks if a string doesn't contain a filesystem path.
checkFilename.comments:
/**
   * Checks if a string doesn't contain a filesystem path.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::checkFilename("Paul"));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::checkFilename("Paul/"));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @return bool
   */

checkPath.name: checkPath
checkPath.summary: Checks if every bit of a string doesn't contain a filesystem path.
checkPath.comments:
/**
   * Checks if every bit of a string doesn't contain a filesystem path.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::checkFilename("Paul"));
   * // (bool) true
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::checkFilename("Paul/"));
   * // (bool) false
   * ```
   *
   * @return bool
   */

hasSlash.name: hasSlash
hasSlash.summary: Returns "true" if slash or backslash are present.
hasSlash.comments:
/**
   * Returns "true" if slash or backslash are present.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::hasSlash("Paul"));
   * // (bool) false
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::hasSlash("Paul/");
   * // (bool) 1
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::hasSlash("Paul\\");
   * // (bool) 1
   * ```
   *
   * @return bool
   */

getNumbers.name: getNumbers
getNumbers.summary: Extracts all digits from a string.
getNumbers.comments:
/**
   * Extracts all digits from a string.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::getNumbers("test 13 example 24"));
   * // (string) "1324"
   *
   * X::dump(\bbn\Str::getNumbers("test example"));
   * // (string) ""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st The string.
   * @return string
   */

makeReadable.name: makeReadable
makeReadable.summary: Returns the argumented value, replacing not standard objects (not stdClass) by their class name.
makeReadable.comments:
/**
   * Returns the argumented value, replacing not standard objects (not stdClass) by their class name.
   *
   * ```php
   * $myObj = new stdClass();
   * $myObj->myProp1 = 23;
   * $myObj->myProp2 = "world";
   * $myObj->myProp3 = [1, 5, 6];
   *
   * $user = \bbn\User::getInstance();
   *
   * $myArray = [
   *  'user' => $user,
   *  'obj' => $myObj,
   *  'val' => 23,
   *  'text' => "Hello!"
   * ];
   *
   * X::hdump(\bbn\Str::makeReadable($user));
   * // (string) "appui/user"
   *
   * X::hdump(\bbn\Str::makeReadable($myArray));
   * /* (array)
   * [
   *   "user" => "appui\\user",
   *   "obj" => [
   *             "myProp1" => 23,
   *             "myProp2" => "world",
   *             "myProp3" => [1, 5, 6,],
   *       ],
   *   "val" => 23,
   *   "text" => "Hello!",
   * ]
   * ```
   *
   * @param mixed $o The item.
   * @return array|string
   */

export.name: export
export.summary: Returns a variable in a mode that is directly usable by PHP.

replaceOnce.name: replaceOnce
replaceOnce.summary: Replaces part of a string. If the part is not found, the method returns the string without change.
replaceOnce.comments:
/**
   * Replaces part of a string. If the part is not found, the method returns the string without change.
   *
   * ```php
   * X::hdump(\bbn\Str::replaceOnce("cold","hot", "Today there is cold"));
   * // (string)  "Today there is hot"
   * X::hdump(\bbn\Str::replaceOnce("rain","hot", "Today there is cold"));
   * // (string)  "Today there is cold"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $search  The string to search
   * @param string $replace The string to replace
   * @param string $subject The string into search
   * @return string
   */

removeComments.name: removeComments
removeComments.comments:
/**
   * Removes the comments.
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::removeComments("<!--this is a comment-->"));
   *  // (string) ""
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::removeComments("// this is a comment"));
   *  // (string) ""
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::removeComments("/** this is a comment *\/"));
   *  // (string) ""
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @return string
   */

saySize.name: saySize
saySize.summary: Converts the bytes to another unit form.
saySize.comments:
/**
   * Converts the bytes to another unit form.
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::saySize(50000000000, 'G'));
   *  // (string) "46.57 G"
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::saySize(1048576, 'M', 0));
   *  // (string) "1 M"
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::saySize(1048576, 'T', 6));
   *  // (string) "0.000001 T"
   * ```
   *
   * @param int    $bytes     The bytes
   * @param string $unit
   * @param int    $percision
   * @return string
   * @throws \Exception
   */

convertSize.name: convertSize
convertSize.summary: Converts size from one unit to another.
convertSize.comments:
/**
   * Converts size from one unit to another.
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::convertSize(1, 'GB', 'B'));
   *  // (string) "1073741824B"
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::convertSize(1, 'TB', 'GB'));
   *  // (string) "1024GB"
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::convertSize(500000, 'MB', 'TB', 6));
   *  // (string) "0.47684TB"
   * ```
   *
   * @param int $size
   * @param string $unit_orig
   * @param string $unit_dest
   * @param int    $percision
   * @return string
   * @throws \Exception
   */

checkJson.name: checkJson
checkJson.summary: Checks whether a JSON string is valid or not. If $return_error is set to true, the error will be returned.
checkJson.comments:
/**
   * Checks whether a JSON string is valid or not. If $return_error is set to true, the error will be returned.
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::checkJson("{"foo":"bar"}"));
   *  // (bool) true
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::checkJson("foo"));
   *  // (bool) false
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::checkJson("foo", true));
   *  // (string) "Syntax error, malformed JSON"
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $json
   * @param bool   $return_error
   * @return bool|string
   */

asVar.name: asVar
asVar.comments:
/**
   * Places quotes around a string
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::asVar('foo'));
   *  // (string) '"foo"'
   *
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::asVar("foo", "'"));
   *  // (string) "'foo'"
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::asVar("foo'bar"));
   *  // (string) '"foo\'bar"'
   *
   * var_dump(\bbn\Str::asVar("foo'bar", "'"));
   *  // (string) "'foo\'bar'"
   *
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $var
   * @param string $quote
   * @return string
   */

markdown2html.name: markdown2html
markdown2html.summary: Transforms a markdown string into HTML.

arguments.name: single_line
arguments.description: line If true the result will not contain paragraph or block element

params.name: $single
params.description: line If true the result will not contain paragraph or block element

markdown2html.comments:
/** * Transforms a markdown string into HTML. * * ```php * var_dump(\bbn\Str::markdown2html("# foo")); * // (string) '

foo

' * * var_dump(\bbn\Str::markdown2html("**foo**")); * // (string) '

foo

' * * var_dump(\bbn\Str::markdown2html("**foo**", true)); * // (string) 'foo' * ``` * * @param string $st The markdown string * @param boolean $single_line If true the result will not contain paragraph or block element * @return string The HTML string */

toCamel.name: toCamel
toCamel.summary: Converts the given string to camel case.
toCamel.comments:
/**
   * Converts the given string to camel case.
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::toCamel("foo bar"));
   *  // (string) 'fooBar'
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @param string $sep   A separator
   * @param bool   $first Capitalize first character if true
   * @return string
   */

fromCamel.name: fromCamel
fromCamel.summary: Converts the given camel case string to a lower case separated string.
fromCamel.comments:
/**
   * Converts the given camel case string to a lower case separated string.
   *
   * ```php
   *  var_dump(\bbn\Str::fromCamel("fooBar"));
   *  // (string) 'foo bar'
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $st
   * @param string $sep   A separator
   * @param bool   $first Capitalize first character if true
   * @return string
   */

html2text.name: html2text
html2text.summary: Converts HTML to text replacing paragraphs and brs with new lines.
html2text.comments:
/** * Converts HTML to text replacing paragraphs and brs with new lines. * * ```php * var_dump(\bbn\Str::html2text("

foo bar


baz")); * // (string) 'foo bar * baz' * * var_dump(\bbn\Str::html2text('

foo bar


', false)); * // (string) 'foo bar' * ``` * * @param string $st The HTML string * @return string */

text2html.name: text2html
text2html.summary: Converts text to HTML replacing new lines with brs.
text2html.comments:
/** * Converts text to HTML replacing new lines with brs. * * ```php * var_dump(\bbn\Str::text2html("foo\n bar")); * // (string) '

foo
bar

' * * var_dump(\bbn\Str::text2html("foo\n bar", false)); * // (string) 'foo
bar' * ``` * * @param string $st The text string * @return string */

sanitizeHtml.name: sanitizeHtml
sanitizeHtml.summary: Remove malicious code and makes HTML standard compliant.

doc.description: Remove malicious code and makes HTML standard compliant.
